name: The Leave-In Conditioner Cream for Hydrated Hair
categories: Hair, Hair Styling & Treatments, Leave-In Conditioner
about: What it is: A weightless, yet ultra-hydrating, leave-in conditioner cream for fine, dry, or damaged strands that defines texture and reduces frizz...Hair Type: Fine, Medium, and Thick..Hair Texture:  Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily..Hair Concerns:.- Heat Protection.- Dryness.- Curl-Enhancing..Key Benefits:.- Smooths, softens, adds shine.- Hydrates and protects from heat.- Defines natural texture and prevents frizz..Ingredient Callouts: This product is vegan, gluten-free, and cruelty-free...What Else You Need to Know: This is the ultimate leave-in conditioner and subtle styling cream hybrid. It’s a versatile, buildable formula that hydrates damp hair post-shower, and refreshes dry hair between washes. It reduces frizz and flyaways by smoothing strands and adds definition to your hair’s texture—without heaviness or stickiness. Its hydrating properties help restore dry or damaged hair to its natural state while also protecting from future damage...Fragrance Description: Crown Affair’s signature fragrance combines bergamot, yuzu, and lemongrass for a cool, light scent....Clinical Results: In a consumer perception study of 38 women over 3 weeks:.-99% said their hair felt hydrated but not weighed down.-99% said their hair felt softer.-97% said their hair felt less frizzy.-98% said their hair looked more vibrant and had enhanced shine..
ingredients: -Tsubaki Seed Oil: Deeply moisturizes, adds shine, and strengthens strands without weight...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Using the pump applicator, dispense around 1-2 pumps for finer strands, and 3-4 for thicker strands—it’s buildable, so start small and add more as needed..-Use on damp hair to lock-in hydration post-shower and for a consistent, even air dry with defined texture.-Use on dry hair between wash days for a hydration refresh, to subtly style waves or curls, and to smooth strands and reduce frizz or flyaways

reviews.review_text: I have very fine straight Asian hair that is dry at the ends and gets greasy at the top quickly. I’ve struggled to find a hair care brand that I truly love and I’ve never been loyal to any one line or brand until I found Crown Affair through an influencer I follow. I rarely write reviews but felt compelled to because I love this brand and their ethos so much!  Formula: Per the instructions, I use this a few times a week after showering and apply it to wet/damp ends after combing them out. It dries super weightlessly (a must for my very fine hair) and smooths and hydrates my damaged, dry ends. I love how lightweight and non-greasy the formula is. I’ve heard it compared to a lotion which is totally accurate!   Packaging: The packaging is very luxurious, heavy, and feels high quality. I do get a tiny bit nervous about having a glass container on my sink since I can be kind of clumsy and I’m really nearsighted. As a designer, I appreciate how clean and minimal the aesthetic is.  Scent: I have a very sensitive nose (and terrible allergies) but the scent of this doesn’t irritate me at all. The scent is strong but not overpowering and lasts till the 2nd (and sometimes even 3rd day) after initial application. My partner (who is also sensitive to smells) loves it and is constantly sniffing my hair and telling me how good it smells.   Price: My only gripe is that the price point is very high. Between the Ritual Conditioner, Renewal Mask, and Leave-In Conditioner, I would probably only pick one to repurchase since they are all so expensive. Probably the Leave-In because it’s my favorite in terms of thickness, texture, and ease of use and fits my needs best.

reviews.review_text: I NEVER write reviews, not sure why but probably just too busy. I'm writing this one in an attempt to make sure it never disappears from the market:) It is the best hair product I've ever used and I've tried dozens of products. My hair is very very thick and a little frizzy. I use the crown affair oil when my hair id wet to detangle and then I use the leave in conditioner when my hair is dry. It doesn't change over time and in fact it only gets better with time. It just leaves my hair shiny, soft and silky. I absolutely LOVE this product!!!!!

I will sometimes blow dry my hair and curl it and this is also great as a refresher/styling cream on day 3 curls and helps add shine back in along with some great texture. The bottle is also huge, so it'll last a long time. This and the renewal mask are HG's for me!

reviews.review_text: I have fine, straight but voluminous hair and I love how lightweight this leave-in conditioner is. It moisturizes my hair without weighing it down and it smells amazing! I use this in combination with the Crown Affair oil on damp hair and it’s been great for me. I was also surprised by how big the bottle is! reviews.review_text: My 40-year old hair is healthier now and more vibrant.  My hair has body and shine.  The conditioner is light weight, and I use about four pumps when using on my damp long hair.  When using the Crown Affair hair oil first, I’ll use three pumps.
This is a fantastic, hydrating, frizz reducing leave in conditioner.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have to agree with all the 5 star reviews. This product is really as good as all the reviews say! I bought this during the Vib sale after I realized I loved the Crown Affair comb and wanted to try more products from this brand. I have stopped blow drying my hair to make it more healthy and was looking for a leave in/detangler that didn’t weigh my hair down but still leaves it silky and smooth and most importantly without an oily build up. This product does all that and more. It’s amazing and I’ve gotten compliments at work that my hair looks silky (which isn’t the norm as it’s getting humid here). I only need a small amount (one pump) which I put in my hair after I wash and condition. Then I can comb out my hair with very little tangles or pulling which I’m very happy about. I hope they make a smaller travel size version of this product so I can take it on the go during summer travels.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I NEVER leave reviews but I had to for this! I live in Hawaii where it’s obviously hot and humid. This is AMAZING! I left it in overnight and the next morning, my hair was soooo soft and silky! Being that it air dried, that just never happens! I highly recommend this! I can’t wait to try other products from this brand! This is definitely a holy grail product for me if you have dry, frizzy, color treated, damaged hair!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: When it comes to hair, you name a product, I either have it or have tried it. Therefore, when this came out, I felt like I had to give it a try because of the really positive, not incentivized reviews. First thing I noticed: I REALLY DON'T LIKE THE SMELL. Before you get annoyed at me let me explain, I normally don't pick products based on the smell, and I am really not picky about smells either, I think this is the very first time that I am turned off by a product based on the smell of it (and let me tell you, I have tried them all!). It smells like a really strong man cologne, it doesn't necessarily smell bad, it's just really really masculine, which is not my cup of tea. But many people in the reviews said it smells good, so maybe it is just a me problem. Now let's talk about the product itself: it is a really light weight leave in, which is what I like as I use leave in conditioner pretty much every day and I don't wanna weigh down my hair too much, but I don't find anything special in it that justifies the higher price, other than the a really chic, luxurious packaging (that is nice but really does nothing to your hair). So to summarize: Smell is a no, product is oaky and packaging is a yes. I honestly don't know if I would recommend this product or not yet. This is still new and I think I need to try out a little bit more, I won't return it for that reason, but so far I am not in love and it did not seem to do anything extraordinary on my hair that justifies the price.

reviews.review_text: I love this stuff! Recently loosened up some screws in my head and decided to bleach my hair and my hair became extremely dry and brittle! This stuff really locks in hydration and makes hair smoother! My hair is not where is should be after frying it but this leave in has really worked its butt off to help restore it back to life!!!! Only con is the strong scent! Not a bad scent! Just very strong!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have a ton of fine, extremely long blonde hair. Like, far more than the normal blonde. For years I have struggled with finding a product that doesn’t weigh my hair down or make it feel greasy/dirty. I have spent thousands on Oribe, Kerestase, It’s a 10, Redken, Amika with no luck. THIS IS THE PRODUCT!  I can put this on my hair, wet or dry and my hair absorbs it beautifully. It makes my hair look and feel more moisturized and doesn’t look greasy at all. I’m honestly in disbelief that it works so well. When using this after a shower, I put it on my entire lengths and then apply Shu Uemura oil on the ends to lock in the moisture. I used to use It’s a 10 leave-in for years and this combo knocks it out of the park. If you have lots of fine hair - try this!!! You won’t be disappointed.

reviews.review_text: Love this!!! Smells amazing (clean and fresh) and leaves hair so silky and smooth. I have been using it under Olaplex 9 (for heat protection) and I can tell a noticeable difference in how soft and healthy my hair feels

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Only downfall dimethicone, I love how it makes the hair look. I have waist length colored hair that used to look so amazing!!! Full and beautiful, suddenly it started breaking off!!! I’m so sad. Tried many products with more breakage and issues. This was love at first use. Made my fine hair look full and not weighed down, looked good for like 3 days! I’m scared of the dimethicone in this product, most of the products in this line have it. If I had short hair that I cut a lot I wouldn’t worry as much about it. I’m trying to protect and grown back the fullness in my 28” long hair. Sadly I returned, I would have kept using if not for the silicones in it. Maybe I am misinformed about silicones but from what I read dimethicone is one of the ones that will create a cast and build up on the hair. What good is it to wash it off if you will just coat it once again with non water soluble silicone. I wish someone could help me with these hair issues! I’m so tired of trying products only to have more broken hair. I did like this product line the best of all the ones I tried. I didn’t see as much breakage, just worried about long term effects as I said. I have a feeling the previous product I used successfully for five years,  which  has amodimethicone, may have created a cast over my hair and caused it to now break off. Hence my fear of any silicones.

reviews.review_text: I am always skeptical about spending so much money on a single hair product. I always think I'm basically just paying for the brand name and the nice bottle it comes in. However, I took a chance on this one. As a product junkie, I've tried many many leave ins, and can honestly say this one blew most of the ones I've tried out of the water. The scent is hard to put a name to. It's not my favorite, but not unpleasant by any means. I have baby-fine, curly hair, a mixture of 2c,3a, and some 3b. I find it difficult to find products that don't weigh my hair down and also don't use coconut oil and shea butter, as my skin hates those. This was the perfect product for me. I use about 2-3 pumps for my whole head, and add a tiny bit more while styling my hair curly if it feels necessary. It plays well with others. I've used it with several different gels and foams, and had nice results every time. I love using it with curlsmiths new shine jelly or the dippity doo girls with curls mousse (or both). I can't peak to what it does for a blowout or straightening, as I avoid doing that to my hair.
